notes: GM A-body platform shared with Chevrolet El Camino. Coupe utility (pickup/car hybrid) based on Chevelle/Malibu platform. Sprint was renamed to Caballero in 1978. Standard service complexity for 1970s light-duty truck. Data sourced from Wikipedia GMC Sprint / Caballero article, December 19, 2024 revision.

GM G-body platform (1978-1987), downsized from A-body Sprint. Coupe utility design shared with Chevrolet El Camino. Renamed from Sprint starting 1978 model year. Standard service complexity for late-1970s light-duty truck. Data sourced from Wikipedia GMC Sprint / Caballero article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Second generation full-size van platform shared with Chevrolet Van/Sportvan. Vandura was cargo van, Rally was passenger variant with windows. Body-on-frame construction with cab-forward design. Standard service complexity for 1970s full-size commercial van. Data sourced from Wikipedia Chevrolet van article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Heavy-duty conventional cab Class 7/8 trucks for commercial applications. General was medium-duty variant, Brigadier was heavy-duty. Featured air brake systems, multiple diesel engine options from Detroit Diesel, Caterpillar, and Cummins. Requires specialized commercial diesel and air brake system service. Difficulty modifier 1.3 reflects heavy-duty commercial diesel complexity. Data sourced from Wikipedia GMC Brigadier and GMC General articles, December 19, 2024 revision.
